alert.note: Alert for Caribou Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 1:22PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORM SOUTHWEST OF ALPINE MOVING IN THAT GENERAL DIRECTION THROUGH 145 PM MDT... At 119 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm near Alpine, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, brief moderate rain, and small hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects and create rough boating conditions on Palisades Reservoir. Locations impacted include... Southern Palisades Reservoir, Alpine Campground and Alpine Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Palisades Reservoir, now woudl be good time to get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
